snippet: The Stage Deli in Midtown Manhattan closed on Thursday after 75 years, halting its battle for customers and the spotlight with the Carnegie Deli.
abstract: Stage Deli in Midtown Manhattan closes after 75 years, halting its battle for customers and the spotlight with competitor Carnegie Deli; owners blame the devastating decision to close on the sagging economy and spiraling rent.

byline.original: By GLENN COLLINS and FLORENCE FABRICANT

lead_paragraph: The Stage Deli in Midtown Manhattan closed on Thursday after 75 years, halting its battle for customers and the spotlight with the Carnegie Deli.

headline.seo: Stage Deli’s Closing Ends a Restaurant War
headline.main: A Closing Ends an Era, and a Deli War
headline.print_headline: A Closing Ends an Era, and a Deli War
